value.original: This property allows to use unsecured DataSource request.

row.value: This property allows to use unsecured DataSource request.

value.original: This preference allows to include the '_where' parameter in the datasource requests. If this preference is set to true the datasource will take into account the '_where' request parameter, if not it will be ignored.

row.value: This preference allows to include the '_where' parameter in the datasource requests. If this preference is set to true the datasource will take into account the '_where' request parameter, if not it will be ignored.

value.original: Translate Yes/No Reference in Export To CSV

row.value: Translate Yes/No Reference in Export To CSV

value.original: This preference allows the user to translate Yes/No references when uses export to CSV. If this preference is set to true the Yes/No references will translate when export to CSV.

row.value: This preference allows the user to translate Yes/No references when uses export to CSV. If this preference is set to true the Yes/No references will translate when export to CSV.

value.original: This property allows the user to set a message's search key or a plain text. Either the translated message or the plain text (if not message is found) will be included as the CSV footer.

row.value: This property allows the user to set a message's search key or a plain text. Either the translated message or the plain text (if not message is found) will be included as the CSV footer.

value.original: This property allows the user to set a message's search key or a plain text. Either the translated message or the plain text (if not message is found) will be included as the CSV header.

row.value: This property allows the user to set a message's search key or a plain text. Either the translated message or the plain text (if not message is found) will be included as the CSV header.

value.original: This property allows the user to set the character which will be used as field separator on generated CSV files. If it's not set, the comma will be used

row.value: This property allows the user to set the character which will be used as field separator on generated CSV files. If it's not set, the comma will be used

value.original: This property allows the user to set the decimal separator that will be used on the generated CSV files. If it is not set, the decimal separator defined in the Format.xml file will be used

row.value: This property allows the user to set the decimal separator that will be used on the generated CSV files. If it is not set, the decimal separator defined in the Format.xml file will be used

value.original: This property allows the user to configure the Text Encoding of the generated CSV files. Valid values are for example 'iso-8859-1', or 'UTF-8'

row.value: This property allows the user to configure the Text Encoding of the generated CSV files. Valid values are for example 'iso-8859-1', or 'UTF-8'
